text: Hi, I want to apply for GSoC for  <https://julialang.org/jsoc/gsoc/diffeq/#numerical_differential_equations_projects_summer_of_code|Numerical Differential Equations - > <https://julialang.org/jsoc/gsoc/diffeq/#native_julia_ode_sde_dae_dde_and_spde_solvers|Native Julia ODE, SDE, DAE, DDE, and (S)PDE Solvers> and have a query related to that. Within this project it is mentioned that there are multiple possible families of methods to implement, for which students will be paired with researchers. So are we allowed to choose any of the methods or that would be decided from your side ?

text: SciML is under NumFocus this year. <https://sciml.ai/dev/>

text: Thanks Sir. Since you are one of the mentors can you please resolve the above query here or shall I ask the same in personal chat ?

text: As a first step, you could try to make a PR that adds an explicit RK algorithm in <https://github.com/SciML/OrdinaryDiffEq.jl/issues/493> there is some guidance in <http://devdocs.sciml.ai/latest/>
